{"step_by_step_thinking": "Gp IIb/IIIa inhibitors are a class of medications used to prevent platelet aggregation and thrombus formation in the setting of acute coronary syndromes. The drugs in this class include Abciximab, Tirofiban, and Eptifibatide. Prasugrel, on the other hand, is an antiplatelet drug but it is not a Gp IIb/IIIa inhibitor. It is a thienopyridine, which inhibits the P2Y12 ADP receptor on platelets.", "answer_choice": "A. Prasugrel"}
